item.title: 里夫斯准备削减开支计划以遵守财政规则
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）正准备削减开支计划，并要求公共部门提高其糟糕的生产力水平，以弥补政府财政的漏洞。【原文：Rachel Reeves is preparing to cut back her spending plans and demand the public sector improves its woeful levels of productivity, as Britain’s Chancellor of the Exchequer tries to repair a hole in the government’s finances.】

item.title: 澳门博彩业收入超出预期，表明经济放缓趋势正在缓解
item.description: 澳门博彩业收入在 2 月份增长了 6.8%，超过了分析师的预期，这是一个初步迹象，表明拖累这个全球最大博彩中心的经济放缓趋势正在开始缓解。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue rose 6.8% in February, exceeding analyst expectations, in a tentative sign that a slowdown that’s dragged on the world’s biggest gambling hub is starting to ease.】

item.title: 美联社称，联邦工作人员开始收到新邮件，以证明工作的正当性
item.description: 据美联社周五报道，美国联邦政府工作人员再次收到一封电子邮件，要求他们概述自己的成就，这一次还附带了每周一次的信息。【原文：US federal workers again have been receiving an email that demanded them to outline their accomplishments, this time with a message that it would be a weekly occurrence, the Associated Press reported on Friday.】

item.title: 施莱格尔表示，瑞士央行只会在必要时采取负利率政策
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）表示，随着市场对借贷成本将降至零以下的预期减弱，瑞士国家银行只会在必要时重新引入负利率。【原文：The Swiss National Bank will only reintroduce negative interest rates if necessary, President Martin Schlegel said as market expectations that borrowing costs will go below zero fade.】

item.title: 据 Bernama 报道，芯片设计公司 Arm 将在马来西亚设立基地
item.description: 伯纳玛（Bernama）周五援引马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）的话报道称，Arm Holdings Plc 将于下周签署一项协议，在马来西亚建立基地。【原文：Arm Holdings Plc is set to sign a pact next week to establish a base in Malaysia, Bernama reported on Friday, citing Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.】

item.title: 中国工厂活动恢复扩张，但贸易风险加剧
item.description: 中国的工厂活动在 2 月份恢复扩张，这是经济在受到美国提高关税的打击和国内需求疲软的情况下恢复活力的一个迹象。【原文：China’s factory activity returned to expansion in February, a sign of resilience in an economy hit by higher US tariffs and suffering from weak domestic demand.】

item.title: 道富证券、阿波罗因美国证券交易委员会关注而更名私人信贷 ETF
item.description: 华尔街巨头道富银行（State Street Corp. ）和阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：A much-anticipated private credit exchange-traded fund from Wall Street giants State Street Corp. and Apollo Global Management Inc. said it will change its name after the US Securities and Exchange Commission shared concerns over the ETF.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）被勒令面对 SVB Financial 索赔 19 亿美元的诉讼
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的一名联邦法官裁定，联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.【原文：A federal judge in California has ruled the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. must face a lawsuit seeking the return of $1.93 billion the government agency seized after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank in 2023.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁逼近，韩国出口萎缩
item.description: 韩国 2 月份出口萎缩，这对依赖贸易的韩国经济来说又是一个令人担忧的迹象，而此时，韩国官员正争先恐后地与美国接触，希望避免唐纳德-特朗普的关税运动带来的打击。【原文：South Korea’s exports contracted in February in another worrying sign for the trade-reliant economy at a time when officials are scrambling to engage the US in hopes of averting a hit from Donald Trump’s tariff campaign.】

item.title: 瑞安-雷诺兹的 MNTN 提交首次公开募股申请，显示收入增长
item.description: 由好莱坞明星瑞安-雷诺兹（Ryan Reynolds）担任首席创意官的联网电视广告平台 MNTN Inc.【原文：MNTN Inc., a connected TV advertising platform that counts Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds as its chief creative officer, filed for an initial public offering, showing revenue growth and narrowing losses.】

item.title: 最新经济数据加剧美国滞胀担忧
item.description: 美国最近的一系列数据显示通胀回升和经济活动放缓，这加剧了人们对这个世界最大经济体可能正走向滞胀时期的担忧。【原文：A string of recent US data showing resurgent inflation and slowing activity is stoking fears the world’s biggest economy could be heading toward a period of stagflation.】

item.description: 据知情人士透露，宝诗医疗集团（Bausch Health Cos.【原文：Bausch Health Cos. may kick off a new debt offering in the coming weeks as it explores options to refinance near-term liabilities, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 法官称拜州官员藏匿现金违反了对贷款人的义务
item.description: 根据美国法院周五的一项裁决，印度科技公司 Byju's 的一名高级官员违反了他对贷款人的信托责任，错误地向贷款人隐瞒了 5.33 亿美元的资金，这是债权人为收回拖欠的 12 亿美元贷款所取得的胜利。【原文：A top official of Indian tech firm Byju’s violated his fiduciary duty to lenders by wrongly hiding $533 million from them, according to a US court ruling Friday, a win for creditors vying to collect on a defaulted $1.2 billion loan.】

item.title: 债券大跌股票显示华尔街增长躁动加剧
item.description: 对于担心经济的人来说，最近的报告给了他们充分的理由去担心。消费者信心低迷、申请失业救济人数大幅飙升、住房数据黯淡等等。【原文：For anyone worried about the economy, recent reports gave ample reason to fret. Flailing consumer confidence, a big jump in jobless claims, gloomy housing data, and more.】

item.title: Big Lots 缺乏现金支付破产账单，激怒供应商
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，破产零售商 Big Lots Inc. 没有足够的资金向供应商支付在该零售商为避免数百家门店关闭而进行的努力失败期间所提供的所有商品的货款。【原文：Bankrupt retailer Big Lots Inc. doesn’t have enough money to pay suppliers for all the goods provided during the retailer’s failed effort to keep hundreds of stores from closing, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 美国将恢复荷兰鸡蛋进口许可证，价格创历史新高
item.description: 美国计划恢复荷兰鸡蛋产品的进口许可证，因为特朗普政府正努力缓解鸡蛋短缺问题，一打鸡蛋的价格已飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：The US plans to reinstate import licenses for Dutch egg products as the Trump administration works to ease a shortage that’s seen prices for a dozen soar to a record.】

item.title: 贝森特称住房将在数周内 "解冻"，预计通胀率为 2
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，在近期指标低于预期之后，他预计美国房地产市场将回暖，并认为通胀有可能 "迅速 "回到美联储 2% 的目标。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he expects the US housing market to pick up steam after recent indicators came in below forecasts, and sees potential for inflation to return to the Federal Reserve’s 2% target “quickly.”】

item.title: S&P评级转为负面，法国预算遭警告
item.description: S&P全球评级公司将法国的信用评级展望定为负面，这凸显了法国在经历长期政治动荡后，财政状况仍存在不确定性。【原文：S&P Global Ratings put a negative outlook on its assessment of France’s creditworthiness, underscoring enduring uncertainty over the country’s finances after a prolonged period of political turmoil.】

item.title: Synopsys 准备在下周进行约 100 亿美元的债券交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Synopsys 公司正寻求最快于下周出售约 100 亿美元的债券，以帮助其为以 340 亿美元收购软件制造商 Ansys 公司提供资金。【原文：Synopsys Inc. is looking to sell around $10 billion of bonds as soon as next week to help finance its $34 billion acquisition of software maker Ansys Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 国际可可组织称可可略有盈余将缓解创纪录的全球短缺问题
item.description: 全球可可短缺现象在持续三年之后，本季将有所缓解，出现小幅过剩，这对紧张的库存起到有限的缓解作用。【原文：Global cocoa shortages are set to ease this season into a small surplus following three years of shortages, providing limited relief to strained stockpiles.】

item.title: 参议员卢米斯说：比特币储备可能首先来自各州
item.description: 参议员辛西娅-卢米斯（Cynthia Lummis）是一项呼吁美国建立比特币储备的法案的发起人，她表示，该提案的进展可能比许多加密货币倡导者希望的要长。【原文：Senator Cynthia Lummis, the sponsor of a bill calling for the US to set up a Bitcoin reserve, suggested that progress on the proposal is likely to take longer than many crypto advocates would like.】

item.title: 西方科罗拉多资产组合出售给 NGP
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，私募股权公司 NGP Energy Capital Management 是西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum Corp.【原文：Private equity firm NGP Energy Capital Management was the undisclosed buyer of more than $900 million in assets that Occidental Petroleum Corp. agreed to sell earlier this month, according to people familiar this matter.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会对加密货币执法的 "拆除 "既受到欢呼也受到嘲笑
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会以改头换面的方式拉开了新一年的序幕，清除了其在加密货币执法行动方面的记录，并将曾经对数字资产充满敌意的环境变成了一个潜在的避风港。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission has kicked off the new year with a makeover, wiping clean its slate of crypto enforcement actions and turning what was once a hostile landscape for digital assets into a potential haven.】

item.title: 墨西哥愿意对中国征收新关税以规避特朗普关税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，墨西哥愿意提高对中国商品的关税，并想方设法从美国购买更多商品，以避免美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁征收关税。【原文：Mexico is willing to raise tariffs on Chinese goods and find ways to buy more from the US in a bid to avoid duties threatened by President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Grubhub 在 Wonder 交易后裁员 23%，计划进行更多改革
item.description: Grubhub 正在裁员约 23%，并为该公司被 Blue Apron 的所有者 Wonder Group Inc.【原文：Grubhub is cutting about 23% of its workforce and set the stage for more changes at the company following its takeover by Wonder Group Inc., the owner of Blue Apron.】

item.title: 热钱 "以创纪录的速度逃离比特币 ETF 以规避风险
item.description: 2 月份，投资者从美国现货比特币交易所交易基金中撤出了创纪录的 33 亿美元，有望创下比特币交易所交易基金上市以来的最大单月撤出潮，原因是投资者在地缘政治紧张局势加剧和通胀担忧持续存在的情况下寻求更安全的资产避险。【原文：Investors have pulled a record $3.3 billion from US spot-Bitcoin exchange-traded funds in February, poised for the biggest monthly exodus since they debuted, as investors sought refuge in safer assets amid rising geopolitical tensions and persistent inflation concerns.】

item.title: Holcim 考虑将计划中的美国分公司迁至芝加哥市中心
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞士水泥巨头 Holcim Ltd. 正在考虑将其北美业务分拆到芝加哥市中心。【原文：Swiss cement giant Holcim Ltd. is weighing a move to downtown Chicago for the planned spinoff of its North American operations, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储文件发现关税可能增加美国消费者的日常开支
item.description: 周五发表的最新研究显示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普提议对来自中国、墨西哥和加拿大的进口商品征收关税，这可能导致美国消费者在日常购物中面临更高的价格。【原文：President Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs on imports from China, Mexico and Canada could lead US consumers to face higher prices on everyday purchases, according to new research published Friday.】
